results.title: The Music album: songs of the west
results.brief_description: Country and western music performed by Carson Robinson and his Buckaroos, Dick Thomas and Gus Van to a backdrop of horse mustering and log cabins. Includes ‘Where the mountains meet the sky’ and ‘I’m an old cowhand’
results.title_for_label: The Music album: songs of the west

results.title: The Music album: songs of the south
results.brief_description: This film is a compilation of songs originating from the southern states of America featuring “Showboat melodies” performed by The Marshalls including ‘I come from Alabama’, ‘Way down upon the Swanee River’ and ‘Campdown races’ and The Dixiairs performing ‘Waiting for the Robert E. Lee’ and ‘Dear old Southland’.
results.title_for_label: The Music album: songs of the south

Lee’ and ‘Dear old Southland’.

results.title: The Music album: songs of the Irish
results.brief_description: Three Irish songs sung with appropriate settings: 1. There’s nothing like the smile of the Irish. 2. Who threw the overalls in Mrs Murphy’s chowder? 3. It’s a great day for the Irish.

results.title: The Music album: snowtime serenade
results.creator_credit: Castle Films and United World Films
results.brief_description: Songs and music for winter performed by Gloria Jean, The Milt Herth Trio, The Sportsmen, Lee, Lynn and Lou and the Alpine Octes. The following are included: ‘Sly Old Gentleman’, ‘Jingle Bells’, ‘Winter Wonderland’, ‘Fireside Medley’, ‘Polka’.

results.title: The Music album: melody lane
results.brief_description: Three musical performances: 1. “By the light of the silvery moon” with the Dinning Sisters. 2. “Wait ‘til the sun shines Nellie” with Bob Chester and his Orchestra. 3. “Little grey home in the west” with Michael Bartlett.

results.title: The Music album: Ethel Smith, Bette Black and the Henry King Orchestra
results.creator_credit: Castle Films and United World Films
results.brief_description: Four filmed performances: Henry King Orchestra - “Dos Grillitos”; Bette Black sings “Give Out” (accompanied by Henry King Orchestra); Ethel Smith plays on the organ “Paran pan pin - Cachita”; Henry King Orchestra - “El Cumbancheo”.

results.title: The Music album: continental melodies
results.brief_description: A selection of three song and dance performances: 1. “Sombrerita Mia” performed by Carmelita. 2. “Russian Revels” performed by The Lucky Girls. 3. “Brazil” performed by maria Del Ray and Raoul martinez and Milo Menendez and his Orchestra.

results.title: The Music album: 'Blue Danube' and 'Romance'
results.brief_description: An orchestra conducted by Frederick Feher plays Johann Strauss “Blue Danube” with singers Armanda Chinot and Christine McIntyre in first half, followed by a performance of “Romance” with singers Tandy McKenzie and Alice Avalsian.
